title: Accessibility & WCAG Compliance — **specs.md**
summary: > **Goal:** Ship interfaces that are usable by everyone, by default. This spec sets non‑negotiable rules, checklists, and CI gates to meet **WCAG 2.2 AA** (aim for AAA where low‑cost), align with **EN 301 549** (EU), and keep parity on **web (Next.js)** and **mobile (Expo/React Native)**.

title: docblocks/docs/meta/docblocks-process
summary: - Colocate docs beside implementation; avoid barrel /docs folders. - Split intent: - **goal**: why this exists (before implementation). - **how**: operational/runbook steps. - **usage**: quick checklist for consumers.

title: Better Auth + Next.js integration (ContractSpec)
summary: This repo uses Better Auth as the primary auth layer (sessions, organizations, teams, API keys, and OAuth). - Source: `packages/bundles/contractspec-studio/src/application/services/auth.ts` - Important: `nextCookies()` must be the **last** plugin in the Better Auth plugin list so `Set-Cookie` is applied correctly in Next.js environments.

title: ContractSpec CLI
summary: The `@contractspec/app.cli-contractspec` package provides the command-line interface for the ContractSpec ecosystem. It is also exposed via `@contractspec/apps-registry/contractspec` for convenience. ```bash

title: docblocks/docs/tech/contracts/openapi-export
summary: ContractSpec specs can be exported into an **OpenAPI 3.1** document for tooling (SDK generation, docs, gateways). The export is **spec-first**: - Uses `jsonSchemaForSpec(spec)` for input/output JSON Schema (from SchemaModel → zod → JSON Schema)

title: Generate Zod schemas suitable for runtime validation
summary: Import external API definitions into your codebase. Supports both one-time scaffolding and multi-format generation for integration. Generates standard `defineSchemaModel` definitions for full ContractSpec integration.

title: docblocks/docs/tech/contracts/presentations
summary: Unify presentations into one descriptor (`PresentationSpec`) that declares a single source (React component key or BlockNote doc) and a list of output targets (react, markdown, application/json, application/xml). A pluggable `TransformEngine` renders any target and applies PII redaction.

title: docblocks/docs/tech/contracts/README
summary: - `packages/lssm/libs/contracts` defines the contracts core (OperationSpecRegistry, OperationSpec, PresentationSpec, install helpers, REST/MCP adapters). - `packages/lssm/libs/schema` defines the schema dictionary (`SchemaModel`, `FieldType`) used to describe I/O once and map to multiple targets (zod, GraphQL, JSON Schema).

title: docblocks/docs/tech/contracts/workspace-config
summary: ContractSpec uses a hierarchical configuration system anchored by `.contractsrc.json` files. Configuration loader supports standard rc-file discovery (cosmiconfig). The `schemaFormat` option controls the output format of schema generation commands (like `contractspec openapi import`).

title: Examples catalog
summary: Examples are registered as ExampleSpecs and surface DocBlocks for discovery. - Docs index tags should include `examples` to populate the catalog. - Sandbox support is available under `/sandbox`.

title: Docs generator
summary: The generator produces documentation artifacts from registered ContractSpecs and DocBlocks. - Reference pages for operations, events, forms, data views, and presentations - Search index metadata (DocBlocks + routes)

title: Docs publish
summary: Publishing moves generated artifacts to a hosting target with versioning. - Operation: `docs.publish`

title: Contract reference
summary: Contract reference pages are generated from spec metadata plus schema details. - Operation: `docs.contract.reference`

title: Docs index and search
summary: The docs index is the canonical list of DocBlocks exposed to UI and MCP surfaces. - Operation: `docs.search` - Filters: query, tag, kind, visibility

title: Docs system overview
summary: ContractSpec treats documentation as a first-class output of your specs. The docs system combines: - Contract operations and schemas - DocBlocks (goal/how/usage/reference) - Presentations for rendering

title: docblocks/docs/tech/lifecycle-stage-system
summary: This document describes how ContractSpec implements lifecycle detection and guidance. It covers architecture, module boundaries, scoring heuristics, and integration points so libraries, modules, bundles, and Studio surfaces stay synchronized.

title: Agent Adapters
summary: ContractSpec provides specialized adapters for different AI coding agents. Optimized for Anthropic Claude's extended thinking and code generation. Features: - Structured markdown with clear sections - Checklists for steps and verification

title: LLM Export Formats
summary: ContractSpec provides three export formats optimized for different LLM use cases. Best for: Understanding what a spec does, providing background to LLMs. Includes: - Spec name, version, type - Goal and context

title: LLM Integration
summary: ContractSpec provides first-class LLM integration to bridge specifications and AI coding agents. Export specs to markdown in formats optimized for LLM consumption: - **Context format**: Summary for understanding (goal, context, acceptance criteria)

title: Implementation Verification
summary: ContractSpec provides tiered verification to check if implementations comply with specs. Checks TypeScript structure against spec requirements: | Check | What it validates | |-------|------------------|

title: ContractSpec MCP endpoints
summary: Three dedicated MCP servers keep AI agents efficient and scoped: - **Docs MCP**: `/api/mcp/docs` — exposes DocBlocks as resources + presentations. Tool: `docs.search`. - **CLI MCP**: `/api/mcp/cli` — surfaces CLI quickstart/reference/README and suggests commands. Tool: `cli.suggestCommand`.

title: docblocks/docs/tech/presentation-runtime
summary: Cross-platform runtime for list pages and presentation flows. - `@contractspec/lib.presentation-runtime-core`: shared types and config helpers - `@contractspec/lib.presentation-runtime-react`: React hooks (web/native-compatible API)

title: Multi‑File Prisma Schema Conventions (per database)
summary: We adopt Prisma multi‑file schema (GA ≥ v6.7) to organize each database’s models by domain and to import core LSSM module schemas locally. Canonical layout per DB: ``` prisma/ schema/ main.prisma             # datasource + generators only

title: Studio Learning Events
summary: Studio emits lightweight **learning/activity events** to support onboarding, ambient coaching, and learning journeys. - **Studio**: events are persisted to the database in `StudioLearningEvent` and are organization-scoped (optionally project-scoped).

title: Studio learning journeys
summary: Studio supports **DB-backed learning journeys** (onboarding tracks + ambient coach tips) that are advanced by **recorded learning events**. > See also: `/docs/tech/studio/learning-events` for event naming + payload guardrails.

title: Studio Platform Admin Panel
summary: ContractSpec Studio exposes a dedicated **Platform Admin Panel** for users whose **active organization** has: - `Organization.type = PLATFORM_ADMIN` The UI route is: - `/studio/admin` Platform admins **remain in their own organization**. Cross-tenant actions are always explicit and scoped:

title: Studio Project Access via Teams
summary: Studio access control is **organization-first** with optional **team-based sharing**. - `Team` and `TeamMember` define team membership inside an organization. - `StudioProject` is owned by an organization.

title: Studio Project Routing
summary: ContractSpec Studio uses a **project-first URL scheme**: - `/studio/projects` — create, select, and delete projects. - `/studio/{projectSlug}/*` — project modules (canvas/specs/deploy/integrations/evolution/learning).

title: docblocks/docs/tech/studio/sandbox/unlogged
summary: - Route: `/sandbox` - **No auth requirement** - **No PostHog init** - **No Vercel Analytics** - Local-only state (in-browser runtime + localStorage where needed) - Try templates and feature modules safely

title: Studio Teams & Invitations
summary: Studio uses **organization membership** as the base access model. Teams are optional and used to refine access to projects. - **Admins/owners only**: create, rename, delete teams; manage project team access; issue invitations.

title: docblocks/docs/tech/studio/workspace_ops
summary: Base: `/api/workspace-ops` These endpoints are **read-only** in v1 and never push to git: - `GET /api/workspace-ops/:integrationId/config?organizationId=` - `GET /api/workspace-ops/:integrationId/specs?organizationId=`

title: docblocks/docs/tech/studio/workspaces
summary: - **Organization**: the primary grouping boundary for Studio projects. - **Project**: one application (specs, overlays, deployments, integrations, evolution, learning). - **Team**: refines who can see/edit a project within an organization.

title: Hybrid Telemetry Model
summary: ContractSpec uses a hybrid telemetry model where clients can send events either directly to PostHog or via the API server. ``` Is contractspec.api.baseUrl configured? ├── Yes → Send via /api/telemetry/ingest

title: Telemetry Ingest Endpoint
summary: The ContractSpec API provides a telemetry ingest endpoint for clients to send product analytics events. ``` POST /api/telemetry/ingest ``` ```json { "event": "contractspec.vscode.command_run", "distinct_id": "client-uuid",

title: ContractSpec VS Code Extension
summary: The ContractSpec VS Code extension provides spec-first development tooling directly in your editor. - **Real-time Validation**: Get instant feedback on spec errors and warnings as you save files - **Build/Scaffold**: Generate handler and component skeletons from specs (no AI required)

title: ContractSpec Snippets
summary: The VS Code extension includes snippets for common ContractSpec patterns. | Prefix | Description | |--------|-------------| | `contractspec-command` | Create a new command (write operation) | | `contractspec-query` | Create a new query (read-only operation) |

title: WorkflowSpec Overview
summary: WorkflowSpec provides a declarative, versioned format for long-running flows that mix automation and human review. Specs stay inside `@contractspec/lib.contracts` (`src/workflow/spec.ts`) so the same definition powers runtime execution, documentation, and future generation.
